title: type as a argument
body:
in effective go:

You can't actually write a function in Go where the type T is determined by the caller. That's why append is built in: it needs support from the compiler.


if I want to pass a type as argument,i use the client passing MyType T as argument, and the server return is interface.(*MyType). because I am the caller, and i know the real type, so I only want server return a entity which type is MyType
